Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "No valid versions available for pinkie-promise" (#7403) at vuejs/vue
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
2.5.13

### Reproduction link
[https://www.npmjs.com/package/pinkie-promise](https://www.npmjs.com/package/pinkie-promise)

### Steps to reproduce
npm install --global vue-cli   ||   cnpm install --global vue-cli

### What is expected?
Vue can work

### What is actually happening?
Vue cannot work

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Vue router / Webpack dev server shows Cannot GET /path on page refresh now" (#1965) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://codepen.io/anon/pen/XVzRJY](https://codepen.io/anon/pen/XVzRJY)

### Steps to reproduce
Run default installation to create a new project:

`vue init webpack projectName`

The `webpack.dev.conf.js` has been updated in the last update and the routing doesn't work on localhost now in `mode: 'history'`:

1. Run: `npm run dev`
2. Create any component (e.g. `Contact.vue`)  
3. Import it as usual and add the route (e.g. `/contact`)
4. Add `mode: 'history'`

---

- You won't be able to open the route by typing it in the address bar, you'll see: `Cannot GET /contact`
- If you navigate to it by pressing a button with route link, you will see the component, but refresh the page and you'll get the same result: `Cannot GET /contact`

### What is expected?
To work in mode: 'history' on localhost (`npm run dev`)

### What is actually happening?
Router doesn't work in mode: 'history' on localhost (`npm run dev`)

---
Additional info:

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/48123503/why-does-vue-router-webpack-dev-server-shows-cannot-get-path-on-page-refresh

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "typo in doc" (#1966) at vuejs/vue-router
Opened issue "Vue router / Webpack dev server shows Cannot GET /path on page refresh now" (#1965) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://codepen.io/anon/pen/XVzRJY](https://codepen.io/anon/pen/XVzRJY)

### Steps to reproduce
Run default installation to create a new project:

`vue init webpack projectName`

Since `webpack.dev.conf.js` is different now (after the last update) router won't work as intended:

1. Create any component (e.g. `Contact.vue`)  
2. Import it as usual and add the route (e.g. `/contact`)

---

- You won't be able to open the route by typing it in the address bar, you'll see: `Cannot GET /contact`
- If you navigate to it by pressing a button with route link, you will see the component, but refresh the page and you'll get the same result: `Cannot GET /contact`

### What is expected?
To work in mode: 'history'

### What is actually happening?
Router doesn't work in mode: 'history'

---
Additional info:

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/48123503/why-does-vue-router-webpack-dev-server-shows-cannot-get-path-on-page-refresh

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Programmatic navigation to the same named component with different params does not work" (#1964) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
2.7.0

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/L7hscd8h/3388/](https://jsfiddle.net/L7hscd8h/3388/)

### Steps to reproduce
After fiddle is executed, note the initial output, click `foo`, click `bar`

### What is expected?
Initially, the executed fiddle will print the following:

```
clicks: 0
foo
bar
```

Clicking `foo`, the output will update to:

```
clicks: 1
foo
bar

name = 'foo'
$route.params.name = 'foo'
changeCount = 0
```

Clicking `bar`, only the `clicks` will be updated:

```
clicks: 2
foo
bar

name = 'bar'
$route.params.name = 'bar'
changeCount = 1
```

### What is actually happening?
Initially, the executed fiddle will print the following:

```
clicks: 0
foo
bar
```

Clicking `foo`, the output will update to:

```
clicks: 1
foo
bar

name = 'foo'
$route.params.name = 'foo'
changeCount = 0
```

Clicking `bar`, only the `clicks` will be updated:

```
clicks: 2
foo
bar

name = 'foo'
$route.params.name = 'foo'
changeCount = 0
```

---
It seems that programmatic navigation to the same component with different params does not trigger guard or watcher on the route.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
